subject: Generate placeholders for resource proxies before validation
commit_message:
Generate placeholders for resource proxies before validation

Before validating resources, generate placeholder NodeData for them in the
StackDefinition. Currently, all attributes are given a value of None
(consistent with how the get_attr intrinsic functions substitute them when
the resource state indicates that the attributes are not valid now).
Reference IDs are generated as usual (since the logic for what to return
when the state indicates the data are not valid is contained in the
resource plugins).

In the long term, this should help us to remove the state-checking logic
from the intrinsic functions.

In the short term, this allows us to validate template data that is parsed
against the StackDefinition (rather than the Stack), since it gives us a
list of valid attribute names.

subject: Fixes crash Neutron OVS Agent to set tags for ports on Windows
commit_message:
Fixes crash Neutron OVS Agent to set tags for ports on Windows

The Neutron OVS agent on Windows does not set the vlan
tags for the VM ports when using the native implementation.
(using ovsdb_interface = native and of_interface = native)

This happens because: the agent will try to fetch a row
by record. It will check to see if it is a UUID, if the condition
is true it will try to fetch the column directly.

On Windows the name of the ports is a UUID (for Windows
there is no 16 chars length limitation as for Linux).
Since the UUID check will pass, it will try to fetch the
column directly instead of using the lookup table on
Windows and will raise RowNotFound exception.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the exception
RowNotFound in the Windows case; the rule will be fetched
using the lookup table.

Change-Id: Ie0a980eaf2a6956072c2536274252764aadd227d
Closes-Bug: #1670451

subject: Allow an attached volume to be extended
commit_message:
Allow an attached volume to be extended

The purpose of this spec is to change the behavior of the volume extend
API to allow an attached volume to be extended. This allows the
volume driver to extend the existing volume without first requiring
that the volume be detached and put back in the available state.
Nova will be asked to confirm that nova can handle the volume
size change before attempting to increase the size of the volume.
Nova will then be asked to act on the size increase and to allow
the VM to have access to the added space after the volume
driver extends the volume.

Spec started in Liberty.

subject: Fix mitaka online migration for PCI devices
commit_message:
Fix mitaka online migration for PCI devices

Currently, a validation error is thrown if we find any PCI device
records which have not populated the parent_addr column on a nova
upgrade. However, the only PCI records for which a parent_addr
makes sense for are those with a device type of 'type-VF' (ie. an
SRIOV virtual function).  PCI records with a device type of 'type-PF'
or 'type-PCI' will not have a parent_addr.  If any of those records
are present on upgrade, the validation will fail.

This change checks that the device type of the PCI record is
'type-VF' when making sure the parent_addr has been correctly
populated

Closes-Bug: #1680918

subject: Replication with More Granularity (Tiramisu)
commit_message:
Replication with More Granularity (Tiramisu)

In Mitaka, replication v2.1 (Cheesecake) was implemented to support a
disaster recovery scenario when an entire host can be failed over to
a secondary site. Cheesecake API was admin facing.

At the Mitaka mid-cycle meetup, Cinder team decided that after Cheesecake
is implemented, Tiramisu will be the next step. Tiramisu is the code name
for a new set of replication APIs with more granularity. Tiramisu API will
be tenant facing. It gives tenant more control on what should be replicated
together, i.e., a group of volumes.

Note: This spec does not address replication at the single volume level
because it is built upon generic volume groups.

Change-Id: I377fd84bd19ae78dc2e952a7846573546bc83f2c

subject: Avoid to authenticate twice
commit_message:
Avoid to authenticate twice

Currently osc-lib ClientManager[1] gets the auth_ref using get_auth_ref
method from the auth_plugin[2] but this method bypasses the auth plugin
memoize system in get_access method[2] and the auth_ref is not memoized
by the auth plugin. It implies osc-lib authenticates twice:
 - one auth to get an auth_ref in osc-lib
 - one auth to persist an auth_ref in the auth plugin[1] in order to
   perform authenticated requests.

This change updates the ClientManager in order to get the auth_ref using
get_access instead of get_auth_ref and to delegate auth_ref memoize to
the iauth plugin.

[1] osc_lib.clientmanager.ClientManager
[2] keystoneauth1.identity.base

Closes-Bug: #1679069

There was a latent bug in the DB API code such that when we
process filters when listing instances, the various tags

subject: Ports not unplugged following unbind
commit_message:
Ports not unplugged following unbind

When using the networking genericswitch ML2 driver with ironic, neutron
ports on a tenant network are not unplugged after they have been
unbound. This means that the corresponding port remains an untagged
member of the tenant network VLAN on the switch.

This was seen on a Dell/Force10 S6010-ON switch. These switches have
slightly different CLI semantics than Cisco switches, which makes the
plug/unplug operation non-idempotent. The non-idempotent nature of the
operation means that a port that is an access port on one VLAN cannot be
made an access port on another VLAN using the 'plug' command alone - the
'unplug' command is required as well. This means that without manual
intervention, port configuration becomes a 'one shot' activity.

The NGS driver currently unplugs ports from VLANs only when ports are
deleted. However, since (at least) Ocata, ironic unbinds[0] ports before
they are deleted. This means that they lose their port binding
information during an update operation, and therefore do not have the
information required to unplug the port on the switch during the delete
operation.

The solution to this is to add support for unplugging ports following an
unbind operation. This change adds that support to the
update_port_postcommit method of the NGS mechanism driver.

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/19ced862a782f204048ca2cb7f4904d75a6d7925/ironic/drivers/modules/network/neutron.py#L199

Change-Id: Ie4ea148793f9a754fae415c2661c6f2add6a97c8
Closes-Bug: #1683687

subject: libvirt: workaround findmnt behaviour change
commit_message:
libvirt: workaround findmnt behaviour change

findmnt as provided by util-linux-2.23.2-33 now returns 0 when --source
is already mounted on the host under a different mountpoint [1]. This causes
issues in environments where cinder-volume may have already mounted a
given NFS share.

This change works around this behaviour change by using os.path.ismount
to confirm if the target is already a mountpoint and if a source is
provided also checking /proc/mounts to confirm that it is mounted at the
target location.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1405238

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_nfs.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_smbfs.py

host to the volume drivers by I87ceeee1ec46dc22754321574b16e6c47b27a848.
